name: Living Wish
text: You may choose a creature or land card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Living Wish.

editions.flavor: He wished for growth, but not for a way to control it.

name: Livonya Silone
text: First strike; legendary landwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a legendary land.)

editions.flavor: Livonya's own nature is a matter of mystery. Nothing is known for sure, merely rumors of unearthly stealth, and unholy alliances.
Livonya's own nature is a matter of mystery. Nothing is known for sure, merely rumors of unearthly stealth, and unholy alliances.
Don't let its appearance frighten you. Let its claws and teeth do that.
Don't let its appearance frighten you. Let its claws and teeth do that.

name: Llanowar
text:
All creatures have "{T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool."
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, untap all creatures you control.

name: Llanowar Augur
text: Sacrifice Llanowar Augur: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

editions.flavor: "I am irrelevant. The future I hold in my hands is everything."

name: Llanowar Behemoth
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Llanowar Behemoth gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Most people can't build decent weapons out of stone or steel. Trust the elves to do it with only mud and vines."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

"Most people can't build decent weapons out of stone or steel. Trust the elves to do it with only mud and vines."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Llanowar Cavalry
text: {W}: Llanowar Cavalry gains vigilance until end of turn.

editions.flavor: For the first time, elves welcomed Benalish soldiers into the forest with something other than arrows.

name: Llanowar Dead
text: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Just as leaves fall from the branches of a living tree, so too do the dead leave the elfhame.

name: Llanowar Druid
text: {T}, Sacrifice Llanowar Druid: Untap all Forests.

editions.flavor:
"This forest means more to the druids than their own kin. The loss of a tree is like the loss of a child."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Llanowar Elite
text:
Kicker {8} (You may pay an additional {8} as you cast this spell.)
Trample
If Llanowar Elite was kicked, it enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.

name: Llanowar Elves
text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

name: Llanowar Empath
text: When Llanowar Empath enters the battlefield, scry 2, then reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it into your hand. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

name: Llanowar Knight
text: Protection from black

editions.flavor: Her armor and steed were borrowed, but her courage was hers alone.

name: Llanowar Mentor
text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Create a 1/1 green Elf Druid creature token named Llanowar Elves. It has "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool."

name: Llanowar Reborn
text:
Llanowar Reborn enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
Graft 1 (This land enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this land onto it.)

name: Llanowar Sentinel
text: When Llanowar Sentinel enters the battlefield, you may pay {1}{G}. If you do, search your library for a card named Llanowar Sentinel and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"The forest has as many eyes as leaves."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

"The forest has as many eyes as leaves."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Llanowar Vanguard
text: {T}: Llanowar Vanguard gets +0/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Llanowar rallied around Eladamri's banner and united in his name.

name: Llanowar Wastes
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool. Llanowar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.

name: Llawan, Cephalid Empress
text:
When Llawan, Cephalid Empress enters the battlefield, return all blue creatures your opponents control to their owners' hands.
Your opponents can't cast blue creature spells.

name: Loafing Giant
text: Whenever Loafing Giant attacks or blocks, put the top card of your library into your graveyard. If that card is a land card, prevent all combat damage Loafing Giant would deal this turn.

editions.flavor: "Forget it. I'm not getting up today."
Giants sleep soundly and long, sometimes for long enough that a crust of earth and moss grows over them. But inevitably something disturbs their slumber, and they wake unhappy.

name: Loam Dryad
text: {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"I've never known dryads to suffer visitors in their woods. Beware the Ulvenwald when she welcomes you."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

name: Loam Dweller
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor:
"You know its mood by the plants that spring up around it. When it is placid, fields of lilies flow in its wake; when it is angry, every stem has a thorn."
—Isao, Enlightened Bushi

name: Loaming Shaman
text: When Loaming Shaman enters the battlefield, target player shuffles any number of target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.

editions.flavor: His work determines who is remembered and who feeds the worms.
His work determines who is remembered and who feeds the worms.

name: Loam Larva
text: When Loam Larva enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

editions.flavor: The forest floor of Murasa is home to life as diverse and vibrant as that of the canopy above.

name: Loam Lion
text: Loam Lion gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.

editions.flavor: In Zendikar, today's grassland could be tomorrow's jungle, and hunting grounds change as quickly as the weather.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor: In Zendikar, today's grassland could be tomorrow's jungle, and hunting grounds change as quickly as the weather.

name: Loathsome Catoblepas
text:
{2}{G}: Loathsome Catoblepas must be blocked this turn if able.
When Loathsome Catoblepas dies, target creature an opponent controls gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

name: Lobber Crew
text:
Defender
{T}: Lobber Crew deals 1 damage to each opponent.
Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, untap Lobber Crew.

editions.flavor: It's easier to just aim at everything.

name: Lobotomy
text: Target player reveals his or her hand, then you choose a card other than a basic land card from it. Search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as the chosen card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Loch Korrigan
text: {U/B}: Loch Korrigan gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Don't look upon still waters without first breaking the surface. The korrigan will catch you with her gaze and drag you to your death."
—Kithkin superstition

name: Locket of Yesterdays
text: Spells you cast cost {1} less to cast for each card with the same name as that spell in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Every hour, at the turning of the glass, its owner had whispered to the locket, seeding it with secrets. This would be her legacy, her memory, if the rifts should take her.

name: Lockjaw Snapper
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
When Lockjaw Snapper dies, put a -1/-1 counter on each creature with a -1/-1 counter on it.

name: Locust Miser
text: Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by two.

editions.flavor: "They're numerous, attack in swarms, and are always hungry. No wonder we rats hold such a kinship with them."

name: Locust Swarm
text:
Flying
{G}: Regenerate Locust Swarm.
{G}: Untap Locust Swarm. Activate this ability only once each turn.

editions.flavor: Better a fierce thunderhead than a sky filled with locusts.

name: Lodestone Bauble
text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Lodestone Bauble: Put up to four target basic land cards from a player's graveyard on top of his or her library in any order. That player draws a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

name: Lodestone Golem
text: Nonartifact spells cost {1} more to cast.

editions.flavor:
"Somehow it warps the Æther. It brings a strange weight, a blockade in the flow of spellcraft."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

"Somehow it warps the Æther. It brings a strange weight, a blockade in the flow of spellcraft."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

"Somehow it warps the Æther. It brings a strange weight, a blockade in the flow of spellcraft."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

name: Lodestone Myr
text:
Trample
Tap an untapped artifact you control: Lodestone Myr gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: When necessary, myr can override and control any artificial object, as can their creator.
When necessary, myr can override and control any artificial object, as can their creator.
When necessary, myr can override and control any artificial object, as can their creator.

name: Logic Knot
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}.

name: Lonely Sandbar
text:
Lonely Sandbar enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
Cycling {U} ({U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Lone Missionary
text: When Lone Missionary enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.

editions.flavor: His mission has become a grim pilgrimage, a tour of the Eldrazi-stricken outposts across Zendikar. But he marches on alone, stubborn as the daily dawn.
His mission has become a grim pilgrimage, a tour of the Eldrazi-stricken outposts across Zendikar. But he marches on alone, stubborn as the daily dawn.

name: Lone Revenant
text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever Lone Revenant deals combat damage to a player, if you control no other creatures, look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Lone Rider
text:
First strike, lifelink
At the beginning of the end step, if you gained 3 or more life this turn, transform Lone Rider.

editions.flavor:
"Horse and rider are often of one mind."
—Ulda, Gavony Rider

name: Lone Wolf
text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

editions.flavor: A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.
A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.
A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.

name: Lone Wolf of the Natterknolls
text:
Whenever an opponent casts a spell during your turn, draw two cards.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Lone Wolf of the Natterknolls.

editions.flavor: . . . but he'll have you for lunch.

name: Longbow Archer
text: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor:
"If it bears wings, I will pin it to the skies over Tefemburu."
—Roya, Zhalfirin archer

"If it bears wings, I will pin it to the skies over Tefemburu."
—Roya, Zhalfirin archer

"If it bears wings, I will pin it to the skies over Tefemburu."
—Ruya, Zhalfirin archer
Some say they have the blood of hawks running through their veins.

name: Long-Finned Skywhale
text:
Flying
Long-Finned Skywhale can block only creatures with flying.

editions.flavor: The aethersphere is home to the most wondrous beings on all of Kaladesh, although the dangers of traversing it mean that not much is known of them.

name: Long-Forgotten Gohei
text:
Arcane spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Spirit creatures you control get +1/+1.

editions.flavor: Long ago, the priests would wave the gohei to call down the gods. Now it lies forgotten, but the spirits still feel its pull.
Long ago, the priests would wave the gohei to call down the gods. Now it lies forgotten, but the spirits still feel its pull.

name: Longhorn Firebeast
text: When Longhorn Firebeast enters the battlefield, any opponent may have it deal 5 damage to him or her. If a player does, sacrifice Longhorn Firebeast.

editions.flavor: Its blast can fuse armor to bone, leaving skeletons that glint brightly in the sun.

name: Long Road Home
text: Exile target creature. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.flavor: The person who finishes a journey is rarely the same as the one who starts it.

name: Longshot Squad
text:
Outlast {1}{G} ({1}{G}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Outlast only as a sorcery.)
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has reach. (A creature with reach can block creatures with flying.)

name: Long-Term Plans
text: Search your library for a card, shuffle your library, then put that card third from the top.

editions.flavor: "Wait, it'll come to me in a minute."

name: Longtusk Cub
text:
Whenever Longtusk Cub deals combat damage to a player, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Longtusk Cub.

editions.flavor: It won't be small forever.

name: Look at Me, I'm R&D
text:
As Look at Me, I'm R&D comes into play, choose a number and a second number one higher or one lower than that number.
All instances of the first chosen number on permanents, spells, and cards in any zone are the second chosen number.

name: Look at Me, I'm the DCI
text: Ban one card, other than a basic land, for the remainder of the match. (For the remainder of the match, each player removes from the game all copies of that card in play or in any graveyard, hand, library, or sideboard.)

editions.flavor: Few understand the DCI's rigorous decision-making process.

name: Look Skyward and Despair
text: When you set this scheme in motion, create a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying.

editions.flavor: "Today I take the reins of destiny itself. Today the Draconic Apocalypse is upon you."

name: Looming Hoverguard
text:
Flying
When Looming Hoverguard enters the battlefield, put target artifact on top of its owner's library.

editions.flavor: Although mute, hoverguards get their message across loud and clear.

name: Looming Shade
text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: On darkness feeding, in nightmares breeding.
On darkness feeding, in nightmares breeding.
Its form never rests, propelled by some undetectable gale from beyond the gloom.
On darkness feeding, in nightmares breeding.
Its form never rests, propelled by some undetectable gale from beyond the gloom.
The shade tracks victims by reverberations of the pipes, as a spider senses prey tangled in its trembling web.

name: Looming Spires
text:
Looming Spires enters the battlefield tapped.
When Looming Spires enters the battlefield, target creature gets +1/+1 and gains first strike until end of turn.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

name: Loose Lips
text:
As Loose Lips comes into play, choose a sentence with eight or fewer words.
Enchanted creature has flying.
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you draw two cards unless that player says the chosen sentence.

editions.flavor: Your sentence can't be longer than this one.

name: Looter il-Kor
text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Looter il-Kor deals damage to an opponent, draw a card, then discard a card.

editions.flavor: Unable to touch items of value, he goes forth to steal secrets instead.

name: Lord Magnus
text:
First strike
Creatures with plainswalk can be blocked as though they didn't have plainswalk.
Creatures with forestwalk can be blocked as though they didn't have forestwalk.

name: Lord of Extinction
text: Lord of Extinction's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in all graveyards.

editions.flavor: The forlorn cries of the dead combine to make its laugh.

name: Lord of Lineage
text:
Flying
Other Vampire creatures you control get +2/+2.
{T}: Create a 2/2 black Vampire creature token with flying.

name: Lord of Shatterskull Pass
text:
Level up {1}{R} ({1}{R}: Put a level counter on this. Level up only as a sorcery.)
LEVEL 1-5
6/6
LEVEL 6+
6/6
Whenever Lord of Shatterskull Pass attacks, it deals 6 damage to each creature defending player controls.

name: Lord of the Pit
text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
editions.flavor: "My summoning begins your debt, Planeswalker."
"My summoning begins your debt, planeswalker."

name: Lord of the Undead
text:
Other Zombie creatures get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: "I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"

"I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"
—Lord Dralnu
"I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"
"Do not weep at your defeat, my dear. In death, you will serve a greater purpose—mine."

name: Lord of the Unreal
text: Illusion creatures you control get +1/+1 and have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor: "The dream does not end until I say so."

name: Lord of the Void
text:
Flying
Whenever Lord of the Void deals combat damage to a player, exile the top seven cards of that player's library, then put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield under your control.

name: Lord of Tresserhorn
text:
When Lord of Tresserhorn enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life, you sacrifice two creatures, and target opponent draws two cards.
{B}: Regenerate Lord of Tresserhorn.

name: Lore Broker
text: {T}: Each player draws a card, then discards a card.

editions.flavor: Lies are sold as often as truths—and used just as effectively.

name: Lorescale Coatl
text: Whenever you draw a card, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Lorescale Coatl.

editions.flavor:
"The enlightenment I never found in etherium I have found traced in the coatl's scales."
—Ranalus, vedalken heretic

—Ranalus, vedalken heretic

name: Lore Seeker
text: Reveal Lore Seeker as you draft it. After you draft Lore Seeker, you may add a booster pack to the draft. (Your next pick is from that booster pack. Pass it to the next player and it's drafted this draft round.)

editions.flavor: Each volume contains wonders.

name: Loreseeker's Stone
text: {3}, {T}: Draw three cards. This ability costs {1} more to activate for each card in your hand.

editions.flavor: Mages come from far and wide to bathe in its wisdom.

name: Lorthos, the Tidemaker
text: Whenever Lorthos, the Tidemaker attacks, you may pay {8}. If you do, tap up to eight target permanents. Those permanents don't untap during their controllers' next untap steps.

editions.flavor: When Lorthos emerges from his deepwater realm, the tides bow to his will and the coastline cowers in his presence.
When Lorthos emerges from his deepwater realm, the tides bow to his will and the coastline cowers in his presence.

name: Lose Calm
text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste and menace until end of turn. (A creature with menace can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

editions.flavor: A lifetime of discipline forsaken in a moment of rage.

name: Lose Hope
text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

name: Loss
text:
Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

name: Lost Auramancers
text:
Vanishing 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)
When Lost Auramancers dies, if it had no time counters on it, you may search your library for an enchantment card and put it onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.

name: Lost Hours
text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player puts that card into his or her library third from the top.

editions.flavor:
"Your thoughts do not interest me nearly as much as the absence thereof."
—Gorghul, augur of skulls

name: Lost in a Labyrinth
text: Target creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

editions.flavor: Even those who leave the labyrinth never escape it, forever dreaming of their time trapped within.

name: Lost in the Mist
text: Counter target spell. Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The secrets she carried could have saved many lives, but they quietly drowned with her.

name: Lost in the Woods
text: Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Forest card, remove that creature from combat. Then put the revealed card on the bottom of your library.

name: Lost in Thought
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated. Its controller may exile three cards from his or her graveyard for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.

name: Lost Legacy
text: Name a nonartifact, nonland card. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with that name and exile them. That player shuffles his or her library, then draws a card for each card exiled from hand this way.

editions.flavor:
"That name shall not be spoken."
—Baral, Chief of Compliance

name: Lost Leonin
text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

editions.flavor: Mirrans were broken down and rebuilt, made to be loyal servants of the force they had fought.

name: Lost Order of Jarkeld
text:
As Lost Order of Jarkeld enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Lost Order of Jarkeld's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of creatures the chosen player controls.

editions.flavor:

—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

Trample

name: Lotus Bloom
text:
Suspend 3—{0} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, pay {0} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)
{T}, Sacrifice Lotus Bloom: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool.

name: Lotus Blossom
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a petal counter on Lotus Blossom.
{T}, Sacrifice Lotus Blossom: Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool, where X is the number of petal counters on Lotus Blossom.

name: Lotus Cobra
text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Its scales contain the essence of thousands of lotus blooms.
Its scales contain the essence of thousands of lotus blooms.

name: Lotus-Eye Mystics
text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Lotus-Eye Mystics enters the battlefield, return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Every action has a foreseen purpose.

name: Lotus Guardian
text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Lotus fields are too valuable to leave undefended.

name: Lotus Path Djinn
text:
Flying
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: "The lotus takes root where body and mind intersect. It blooms when body and mind become one."

name: Lotus Petal
text: {T}, Sacrifice Lotus Petal: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "Hard to imagine," mused Hanna, stroking the petal, "such a lovely flower inspiring such greed."
"Hard to imagine," mused Hanna, stroking the petal, "such a lovely flower inspiring such greed."
Each of these intricate mechanical petals stores enough power to supply all of Ghirapur, if only for a fleeting moment.
"Hard to imagine," mused Hanna, stroking the petal, "such a lovely flower inspiring such greed."

name: Lotus Vale
text:
If Lotus Vale would enter the battlefield, sacrifice two untapped lands instead. If you do, put Lotus Vale onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: At what price beauty?

name: Lovisa Coldeyes
text: Each creature that's a Barbarian, a Warrior, or a Berserker gets +2/+2 and has haste.

editions.flavor: "I lead my horde to the northwest. I won't return until the ice wizards fall and their fiendish contraptions are crushed!"

name: Lowland Basilisk
text: Whenever Lowland Basilisk deals damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

editions.flavor: Unlike their cousins, Rathi basilisks turn their victims into puddles of flowstone.
Unlike their cousins, Rathi basilisks turn their victims into puddles of flowstone.
"Faugh!" snorted Tahngarth. "Why would it make a meal of something like you?" Squee looked relieved. "No," he continued, "you'd make a much better toothpick."
